DOC.detailed_description: Background aim : Patients chronic respiratory disorder , intubate mechanically-ventilated intensive care unit ( ICU ) , often exhibit hypercapnia spontaneous breathe trial prior extubation ; associate increase incidence extubation failure mortality . We assess efficacy noninvasive ventilation ( NIV ) prevention extubation failure mortality patient . Design : Prospective , randomize , control clinical trial two group : support noninvasive ventilation , conventional clinical management ( control group ) . Subjects : Patients chronic respiratory disorder , intubate ventilate Â³48 hour , hypercapnia ( PaCO2 > 45 mmHg ) spontaneous breathe trial , ready extubated . Interventions : Random allocation two group : NIV immediately extubation 24 hour , conventional clinical management . Clinical follow-up ( incidence extubation failure , reintubation , ICU hospital mortality , 90-day survival , complication associate mechanical ventilation , ICU hospital length stay ) . Analyses data : Comparison two group ( NIV control ) non-paired data design : quantitative variable ( t-test , Mann-Whitney test , ROC curve ) , qualitative categorical variable ( chi square , Fisher 's exact test ) , Kaplan-Meier estimate survival curve ) .
